mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Age and sports
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Youth sports: Is early competition healthy?
mdRecord.dcterms:description: From fall soccer to summer softball, there are programs to keep children busy year round. Some say that competition at an early age is healthy, while there are those who worry that children find winning more important than the fun of competing. Len Gunisor talks about youth sports
mdRecord.dcterms:provenance: George Mason University Libraries Special Collections Research Center
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: George Mason University "Frankly Speaking" radio show collection
